question: David has 15 tubes of orange paint and 6 tubes of black paint. Oliver has two thirds as many tubes of orange paint as David, and two times as many tubes of black paint as David. How many tubes of paint does Oliver have?
answer:
Oliver has 15*2/3= <<15*2/3=10>>10 tubes of orange paint
Oliver has 6*2=<<6*2=12>>12 tubes of black paint
Oliver has a total of 10+12 =<<10+12=22>>22 tubes of paint
#### 22
